   So the code for the first part in C would be:

   int main() {

      int n;

      scanf("%d", &n);

      int a[n];

      for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {

          scanf("%d", &a[i]);

      }

      int counter_turns = -1;

      int counter =0;

      while (counter < n) {

          counter_turns +=1;

          // process each element in current array.

          for (int i=0; i <n; i++) {

              if (a[i] != -1 && a[i] <= counter) {

                  a[i] = -1;

                  counter++;

              }

          }

          // reverse the array.

          for (int i=0; i <n/2; i++) {

              int temp = a[i];

              a[i] = a[n-1 -i];

              a[n-1 -i] = temp;

          }

      }

      // Now, the first part's output is counter_turns.

      // Now, pass this to the second part.

      // The second part expects a string input, which is the output of the first part.

      // So convert counter_turns to a string.

      char s[20]; // enough to hold the number as a string.

      sprintf(s, "%d", counter_turns);

      // Now process the second part.

      // Second part's code:

      // Check if s contains both 'A' and 'B'.

      int hasA = 0, hasB =0;

      for (int i=0; s[i] != '\0'; i++) {

          if (s[i] == 'A') hasA =1;

          if (s[i] == 'B') hasB =1;

      }

      printf("%s\n", (hasA && hasB) ? "Yes" : "No");

      return 0;

   }
